body.name: ANNKE 1080P Security Camera AHD/TVI/CVI/CVBS 4-in-1 CCTV Bullet Wired Camera, IP66 Weatherproof Analog Surveillance Video Camera for Indoor and Outdoor Use, 100ft Clear Night Vision (AN-C51EJ0103#US)

features: 【Crystal Clear 1080p Footage】With this 2MP security camera, you can see everything clearly that matters in 1080p HD, easily recognize the details you need in smooth and clear videos, leaving nothing to the imagination.

【Powerful 4-IN-1 Compatibility】This security camera supports AHD/TVI/CVI/CVBS video output (default AHD), and it is compatible with ANNKE DVRs and most third-party DVRs on the market. With the foolproof joystick switch on the cable, you can freely access the OSD menu and switch the video output mode by pushing the control button.

【100ft IR Night Vision&IP66 Weatherproof】The equipped premium IR LEDs are automatically activated in low light conditions so that you can capture clear B&W vision at dawn, dust, night, on rainy days or any conditions with low light illumination. Built with IP66 weatherproof housing, the CCTV camera is able to endure whatever mother nature brings, thus keep out dust, water and air. It is tested that it can perform well even in extreme temperatures from -4 °F to 122 °F.

【Easy to Install and Operate】With the adjustable 3-axis stand, you can freely adjust the camera head to fix it to the desired angle. And the outdoor camera is CE/FCC certified; you can always rely on its high-quality power adapter.

【NO Power Adapter Included&NEED Connect DVR System to Work】 This Camera does not comes with a power adapter. Customer need to buy extra power adapter to connect this camera to make it work. And this security camera can not be used alone. Need to connect a DVR to make it work. The package only comes with 1.97ft/60cm BNC Cable for test.

Adjustable 3-Axis Bracket Adjust cameras' angle and field of view effortlessly.

IP66 Weatherproof Rated IP66 waterproof and dust-proof, this camera braves all harsh conditions and is never afraid of pouring rain or heavy snow. WDR Helps Stay Sharp Farewell to blind spots due to strong light contrast. With a digital WDR function, this camera catches sharp pictures even under strong contrast. 3D DNR Be Invulnerable to Noise Equipped with the latest 3D DNR, the cam reduces noise and brings clear images in the dark while other regular cams can't get rid of the noise.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A nice upgrade to my 720p cameras
reviews.reviewText: I bought an 8 camera dvr that came with 4 cameras, intending to use some of my existing composite video cameras for the remaining 4 ports... Of course after a while with the 720 line cameras, I realized the old 480 line cameras were not very useful, so I have been aching for an upgrade. I looking at the options, and I saw this one was full HD, and it supported the three different standards for analog HD over coax, which is the common signal type for security DVR's. So this camera can use the same cabling as your older low resolution SD 480 line cameras, but it produces the full HD image for hd capable security DVRs. It has a pair of dip switches for selecting beteewn TVI, AHD, CVBS, and CVI. Keep in mind that these standards are analog, so the cable length and cable quality still have a big effect on the signal quality. The camera itself is digital, but the signals for the coax have to be analog for these standards.Comparing the 1080 camera to my existing 720 cameras, the differences are striking, as I have a much larger field of view with the new 1080 line camera. The older model C11N 720 line camers have a narrower field of view, so the ability to resolve details is about the same, but the 1080 has a much larger image. Both cameras have the same 3.6mm lens, but the camera chip on the new camera is larger, giving it a wider field of view from the same lens. So it is kind of hard to do too much of a side by side comparison, but the pixels seem to be about the same size, but now I can see the whole driveway with just one camera.I have some IP cameras I have been working with, and they perform very well, but you must run new cables, or depend on wifi for those to work. The big advantage of this model I am reviewing is I can just replace the existing cameras and not have to run new wires, and enjoy a big improvement, and they cost a lot less than IP cameras. I had a large number of IP cameras, and while I always like them in the begining, they ALL fail within 1 or 2 years, or they keep crashing. The standard cameras that run over coax tend to work forever, I have had zero failures with this camera type.The camera is of sturdy metal construction, just like my other Annke cameras. It comes with it's own swivel mount, with an allen wrench to tighten it once you have it in position. It also has a tripod thread mount you can use if you have an existing mount you want to reuse. The swivel comes right off using the included allen wrench. The metal case is well sealed, I've never had any of my Annke cameras leak or get internally fogged, like some of the cheaper cameras. So it should be very durable.The Annke night vision is superior to others I have used because the LED illuminators have their own glass. separated from the glass covering the lens. This is an important feature, because the other brands of night vision cameras I have tried have one glass covering the camera and LED's, which causes glare when in night mode. The other brands put a black ring behind the glass to block the glare, but the glass conducts the glare right past the ring. The Annke design cures this problem, and produces a clean and clear night vision performance.So once again, Annke has produced a nice, solid performing, affordable camera. It drops into an existing camera installation using the existing wire, and has modes to support the various standards for coax based security cameras, so it should work with most analog DVRs. Installing the cables can be the most expensive part of a security rollout, so it is nice that you can reused your existing infrastructure. Well done, Annke!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super, Super camera in all lights
reviews.reviewText: I installed this camera around my home and the quality stands as a benchmark for the company. The night vision is of equal quality for depth and clarity, I don't use the motion detection so I can't give a recommendation for that but overall this is an excellent product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very good - except for two aspects
reviews.reviewText: This camera gives impressively good image clarity and night vision image brightness. Unfortunately, it causes incessant false-triggering of the DVR's motion detection while in night vision mode. I haven't been able to resolve this by any adjustment of the DVR's motion detection parameters (sensitivity, etc.). My guess is that the IR illumination is so intense that it causes an over-saturation of the image which in turn spoofs the DVR's motion-sensing algorithms. (It is especially frustrating that the DVR is the same brand as this camera, yet it causes motion-sensing issues while other brands of similar cameras used on the same DVR do not produce false triggers of the DVR's motion detection. Weird!) The other thing that I don't like about this camera's mount is - unfortunately - a common problem shared by many cameras: The mount's aiming adjustments are secured by set-screws, which often are difficult to access when the camera's housing is in the desired aiming position, making installation/adjustment more painful than it need be. Although this is a very common mounting/aiming "mechanism", it is much inferior to the universal ball-joint/locking ring "mechanism" that's available on some cameras - which does not have tiny set screws to be loosened/tightened individually (with the potential for them falling out and getting lost), and provides a quick and simple "point-and-lock" aiming adjustment - unlike this camera's mechanism that requires two separate axis adjustments plus a tilt adjustment - which are time-consuming, fiddly, and risk the loss of adjustment tools and/or set-screws. So, unfortunately, this otherwise very nice camera is hampered by an archaic aiming mechanism.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Finally found a camera that works with my system, dose an amazing job very clear picture, great night vision. Will definitely be ordering more!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality replacement camera
reviews.reviewText: 4 in 1 option is a good for different systems. Crystal clear images. Night vision is exceptional considering this camera has 12 IRs and the one it replaced has 34 Irs. Quality and price impressed enough that I bought a second camera to have on hand for an older system.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Took 20 minutes to revive but now working....
reviews.reviewText: Well 20 minutes later, managed to get the thing to breathe life again. Once it works it seems to have a fantastic picture. Don't know how long it's going to last but hopefully better than it did before so far I beat the 3 seconds it's been about 5 minutes and it's still running. I'll give it some time to see if it lasts or if it just burst into a bunch of smoke. The support page is very user unfriendly. It's absolutely worthless tells you absolutely nothing. We had to figure this out on our own poking and prodding, but it finally came to life. Like Frankenstein's monster. It lives! Hopefully it'll stay alive because when it's working again, it has a great picture. Time will tell. Again $20 and change, I can't expect perfection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great camera, great price and great quality. Really bright clear picture, color is great and night vision is awesome.

reviews.reviewTitle: arrived promptly and works as described
reviews.reviewText: It is used to replace a malfunctioning camera on an older Swann security camera system.Original Swan cameras are no longer available. This one works just fine.
Thanks guys. Quick delivery & great price. Upgraded my old camera's & these are much better.
A little bit pricey, but an excellent camera. Plug and play into my existing cable and DVR. Easy.

These are NOT 1080p cameras. I mean they may have the specs but the quality of the image is extremely poor. It has a grainy not sharp image. I have 720p cameras and they give a really nice crisp and high def image which are far far superior to these rubbish cameras. I can't believe I bought and am now stuck with two of them. I should have known that at this price I was going to be getting rubbish but I guess I was hopeful that they would be ok.
